For this custom of sitting prevailed after the death of Gamaliel, who took the chair many years after this that we are now upon. The great Hillel possessed the seat at this time; or if he was newly dead, his son Simeon succeeded him: so that it was the disciples’ part in this age to stand, not to sit in the presence of their doctors. How therefore should it be said of Christ, that he was “ sitting among the doctors 3” Let the following clause solve the difficulty :
